abstract: New York State's Joint Commission on Public Ethics adopts two advisory opinions that will make fund-raising restrictions for elected officials tighter and will widen disclosure requirements for public-relations consultants; measures are meant to address commission's poor public image and reputation for inactivity.
lead_paragraph: One rule is meant to restrict some campaign donations, and another widens the disclosure rules for public relations consultants who speak to journalists.

headline.main: Albany Ethics Commission Adopts New Fund-Raising and Disclosure Rules
